results.title: One Week Later
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Mandy Rathbone, Ferndown Upper School, PVA Medialab and First Light
results.brief_description: Told through the eyes of a younger pupil, who surveys the relationships his brother has with his peer group. As revelations and misunderstandings occur, due to the misuse of the ubiquitous mobile phone, the week’s events come to a climax on a Friday afternoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Snelling, Mandy Rathbone, Ferndown Upper School, PVA Medialab and First Light

results.title: One Man's Walk
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Mitchell, Interplay Theatre and First Light
results.brief_description: A boy walks down a street. We do not see his face. He is the event but we don’t know why. He tells us his likes and dislikes as he passes through the streets of his town. Finally we see his face and understand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Mitchell, Interplay Theatre and First Light

results.title: Olympic Legacy: this was forever
results.creator_credit: Mark Aitken, Polkadotsonraindrops and First Light
results.brief_description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.
results.description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

results.title: My Grandma
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Taylor, Smith and Watson Productions, Wide Eyed and First Light
results.brief_description: Jamie is a girl who just wants to enjoy herself. However, she is constantly called upon to care for her demanding Grandmother. She is tired of hearing tales of Grandma’s childhood whilst missing out on her own. Successfully demonstrating the difference between two generations of women, will her Grandma’s constant nagging and complaining push Jamie too far?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Taylor, Smith and Watson Productions, Wide Eyed and First Light

results.title: A Mile in our Shoes
results.creator_credit: Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: The average age of a young carer in the UK is 12. This is a poignant and moving tribute to those many young carers tending to parents or siblings or both. They manage the domestic needs of a household as well as the physical needs of those they are caring for. They sometimes care for more than one family member with ailments ranging from autism to muscular dystrophy. With a constant lack of understanding from the rest of the world, no wonder there is little time for sleep let alone a social life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light

results.title: Destination Point
results.creator_credit: Bloom Productions, Argyle Primary School and First Light
results.brief_description: Year 5 Primary school pupils from Kings Cross explore the ethnic diversity of their area and school. Kings Cross is an international destination point. Thousands of people travel in and out of the station every day. Some are travelling through on their way to somewhere else, some come into work and others travel to Kings Cross and make it home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bloom Productions, Argyle Primary School and First Light

results.title: The Box
results.creator_credit: Felix Drake, Phoebe Flemming, eShed, Watershed and First Light
results.brief_description: This short drama is a tight observation of family life during the recession. Shot in a single living room, we see the ebb and flow of family life reflected in some pivotal moments through a particularly difficult time. However, the digital hearth remains a constant source of comfort.

results.title: Beloved
results.creator_credit: Daniel Zinkant, Elle Farnham, Suited & Booted Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: Through the main protagonist Dave, we hear and see what it is like to be in love and have those feelings trapped inside. As we are let into Dave’s world, we see him and a group of friends as they leave school and embark on their journey home. The film flicks between two worlds of fantasy and real-life as the journey progresses. As the narrative comes to an end, we watch the three friends depart and Dave is left alone. His love unknown, unsaid but only understood by the viewer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Zinkant, Elle Farnham, Suited & Booted Studios and First Light

results.title: Carriers at War II for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Three 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, colour map, warranty card, subscription card, catalogue and manual in a cardboard box
results.brief_description: This sequel to Carriers at War retains the same realistic take on strategic warfare. However, the game’s focus has moved from the WWII Pacfic Theatre to battles in Southeast Asia from between 1936-1946.
